summary.seg: This manuscript, copied in 1652 or 1653, contains Greek and Arabic hymns and other liturgical texts for the great festivals of Easter, Christmas and Epiphany. The bulk of the texts here are hymns written in Greek only. There are two New Testament lections included, which are writen in both Greek and Arabic in parallel columns on the same page, accompanied by a communion hymn (koinonikon) also in Greek and Arabic. There are also a few prayers and other prose texts written in Arabic alone. Some grammatical notes have been added after the end of the main content.
The copying of the manuscript can be dated from the colophon recording its completion on f. 94v, which identifies the copyist as a priest named Ioannes, from Damascus.

msItem.title: Canon for Easter Saturday
msItem.rubric: f. 1v Κανὼν τῷ ἁγίω καὶ μεγάλη Σαββάτω
msItem.incipit: f. 1v Κύματι θαλάσσης, τὸν κρύψαντα πάλαι
msItem.explicit: f. 15r καὶ ἀνέστη σώζων ἡμᾶς ἀλληλούια· ἀλληλούια· ἀλληλούια
msItem.note: f. 1r is blank apart from some later notes

msItem.title: Canon for Easter Sunday
msItem.rubric: f. 15v Κανὼν τοι ἁγίω καὶ μεγάλη Κυριακὴ τοῦ Πάσχα
msItem.explicit: f. 28r καὶ τοῖς ἐν τοῖς μνήμασιν· ζωὴν χαρισάμενος

msItem.title: Hours of Holy Week
msItem.rubric: f. 28v Αἱ ὤραι τῆς εὐδομάδος τοῦ Πάσχα
msItem.incipit: f. 28v Χριστὸς ἀνέστη ἐκ νεκρῶν, θανάτω θάνατον πατήσας
msItem.explicit: f. 30v εὐλογημένη σὺ ἐν γυναιψὶ· ὑ ὑπάρχεις πανάμωμε δέσποινα

msItem.title: Antiphons for the liturgy
msItem.rubric: f. 31r Εἰς τὴν λειτουργίαν τὰ πάροντα ἀντίφωνα
msItem.incipit: f. 31r Ἀλαλάζατε τῷ Κυρίῳ πᾶσα ἡ γῆ

msItem.title: Antiphons for the liturgy
msItem.incipit: f. 32r Αὔτη ἡμέρα ἢν ἐποίησεν ὁ Κύριος
msItem.explicit: f. 32v Ἐξομολογεῖσθαι τῷ Κθρίῳ ὅτι ἀγαθὸς

msItem.title: Acts of the Apostles
msItem.incipit: f. 32v Τὸν μὲν πρῶτον λόγον ἐποιησάμην περὶ πάντων ὡ Θεόφιλε
msItem.explicit: f. 34r καὶ ἔως ἐσχάτου τῆς γῆς

msItem.title: Gospel of John
msItem.incipit: f. 34r Ἐν ἀρχῆ ἦν ὁ λόγος, καὶ ὁ λόγος ἢν πρὸς τὸν Θεὸν
msItem.explicit: f. 36v ἡ χάρις καὶ ἡ ἀλήθεια διὰ Ἰησοῦ Χριστοῦ ἐγένετο

msItem.title: Koinonikon
msItem.incipit: f. 36v Σῶμα Χριστοῦ μεταλάβετε· πηγῆς αθανάτου γεῦσασθαι καὶ ἵδετε
msItem.explicit: f. 37r ὁψώμεθα τὸν Κύριον ἐγειρμένον ἐκ νεκρῶν: Πᾶλιν Σῶμα Χριστοῦ

msItem.title: Megalynaria for Easter Sunday
msItem.rubric: f. 37v Μεγαλυνάρια τὴν λαμπρᾶν Κυριακῆ εἰς τὴν θʹ ὠδὴ ἠχος· αʹ
msItem.incipit: f. 37v Ὁ ἄγγελος ἐβόα τῆ χαριτωμένη
msItem.explicit: f. 39v καὶ τοὺς νεκροὺς ἐγείρας λαοὶ ἀγαλλιᾶσθαι

msItem.title: Canon for Christmas Day
msItem.rubric: f. 42v Ἡ κατα σάρκα γέννησις τοῦ Κυρίου ἡμῶν Ἰησοῦ Χριστοῦ οἱ κανόνες
msItem.incipit: f. 42v Χριστὸς γεννάτε δοξάσατε, Χριστὸς ἐξ οὐρανῶν ἀπαντήσατε
msItem.explicit: f. 63v καὶ ἐπὶ γῆς εἰρήνη, ἐν ἀνθρωποὶς εὐδοκία

msItem.title: Doxology
msItem.rubric: f. 64r Δοξολογία μεγάλη καὶ ἀπόλ[___] εἰς τὴν λειτουργίαν ἀντίφωνα
msItem.incipit: f. 64r Ἐξομολογήσομαί σοι Κύριε ἐν ὄλη καρδία μου
msItem.explicit: f. 65r ἐν ἡμέρα τῆς δυνάμεως σου· ἡ γέννησίς σου

msItem.title: Kontakion for Christmas
msItem.rubric: f. 65r Ἡ γέννησις σου Χριστὲ ὁ Θεὸς ἡμῶν τὸ κοντάκιον
msItem.incipit: f. 65r Ἡ πάρθενος σήμερον, τὸν ὑπέρ σου
msItem.explicit: f. 65r ἀντι δὲ τὸ τρισάγιον σοι εἰς Χριστὸν εβαπ[___]

msItem.title: Canon for Epiphany
msItem.rubric: f. 67r Τὰ ἁγία θεοφάνια τοῦ Κυρίου Θεοῦ καὶ σωτῆρος ἡμῶν Ἰησοῦ Χριστοῦ
msItem.incipit: f. 67r Βυθοῦ ἀνεκάλυψε πυθμένα, καὶ δια ξηρᾶς οἱκείους ἔλκει
msItem.explicit: f. 88v ἀντὶ δὲ τοῦ τρισάγιον ὅσοι εἰς Χριστὸν εβαπτίσθητε

msItem.title: Polyeleos (Psalms 134-135)
msItem.rubric: f. 90v Ψαλμὸς τὸ πολυέλεον δούλοι Κυρίου
msItem.incipit: f. 90v Αἰνεῖτε τὸ ὄνομα Κυρίου· αἰνεῖτε δούλοι Κυρίου
msItem.explicit: f. 94v >οτι εἰς τὸν αίῶνα τὸ ἔλεος αὐτοῦ

msItem.colophon: f. 94v, lines 10-13 Τέλος ἐκ χεὶρ Ἱωάννου ἱερέος ἐκ Δαμασκοῦ ͵ζρξαʹ τοῦ Ἀδὰμ

support.material: Western paper, folded in octavo. Watermark: Three crescents ( c. 30 c. 65 ) at the upper end of the gutter..

supportDesc.foliation: The manuscript is foliated with the numbers 1-98, in pencil, in Arabic numerals, recto, at the lower right-hand corner of the written area.

collation.p: The manuscript consists of 10 quires, all of them quinia.

list.item: Quire 110-1 ff. 1-9 The first folio has been cancelled, without loss of text.
Quire 1010-1 ff. 90-98 The last folio has been cancelled, without loss of text.

collation.signatures: There are original quire signatures in Greek numerals, in black or red ink, on the first folio of each quire, recto, lower right, and the last folio of each quire, verso, lower left. They survive on every quire except the last (αʹ-θʹ).
There are also quire signatures in Greek numerals, in black ink, on the first folio of each quire, recto, upper right, and the last folio of each quire, verso, upper left.
collation.catchwords: Catchwords appear on many verso folios, not only those at the end of quires.

supportDesc.condition: There is some water staining, growing more severe in the latter part of the manuscript, and some areas of dirt.

layoutDesc.layout:
ff. 1v-32r, 37v-95r A single column of 15 lines. 95-102 55
Ruled in hardpoint, type similar to Leroy 00D1. Text hangs from the lines.

ff. 32v-37r Two columns of 15 lines. 95 55
Ruled in hardpoint, in a single column, type similar to Leroy 00D1. Text hangs from the lines.

handNote.p: The Greek text was copied by Ioannes in an upright Hodegon-style mixed minuscule script, in black ink, with moderate variation in letter size.

Syllabic abbreviations and superscription of word endings appear only at the end of lines. Breathings are round and mute iota is subscript. Use of the double dot is functional only, but a single dot sometimes appears above iota when it is unaccentuated. There is accentuation of all nomina sacra. Accents are sometimes joined to nomina sacra strokes.
Punctuation used includes the middle and upper points, lower and middle commas and full stop.
The same hand has added headings and other rubric in the same style in red ink, often gilded.
The same hand appears to be responsible for the Arabic text, in red and black ink.

decoDesc.decoNote: The beginnings of sections on ff. 1v, 15v, 28v, 42v, 67r and 90v are preceded by headpieces in various plaited designs, in combinations of red, blue and black paint and gold.
Sections begin with minor initials in red ink, usually gilded, often with ornament in red ink and blue paint. Some sub-sections begin with normal-sized initial letters in red ink.
Many headings and annotations forming part of the original text are gilded.
The beginnings of prayers on ff. 31r and 90r are each accompanied by small quatrefoil plaits in red and black paint and gold (f. 31r) or black ink (90r).

physDesc.additions:
There is a note of purchase or ownership in pencil on f. 1r: Charles Ovenden Cairo 27 Nov 1835.
A slip of paper pasted to f. 1r carries a note of content and date in ink: Canons & Hymns of the Greek Church. MS on paper, 98ll. in Greek & Arabic. Saeculum XVII. Below this is a dated note in pencil with the initials G.D., probably by George Dunn: Χ(ρίστ)ε G.D. June 1901.
A printed note of ownership is pasted to the front pastedown: From the library of George Dunn of Woolley Hall near Maidenhead .

binding.p: 17th-century Islamic full leather binding over couched-laminate boards, with marbled paper pastedowns. Both boards are decorated with gold tooling. The classmark appears on labels on the spine.

history.origin: The manuscript was copied by the priest Ioannes Ioannes, priest , from Damascus, in 1652/3, as indicated by his colophon on f. 94v.

provenance.p: Owned by Charles Ovenden Ovenden, Charles , who probably bought it in Cairo on 27 November 1835.
Owned by the book collector George Dunn (1864-1912) Dunn, George, 1864-1912 , who perhaps acquired it in June 1901.

availability.p: Visitors to Christ's who wish to consult Special Collections material are required to apply to the Library in advance of their visit. For information on eligibility and admission procedures see: Christ's College Old Library.
